result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan John Riegert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: JOC returned by USPS - No mail receptacle - Unable to Forward

Case Called @ 3:17 PM: Defendant Logan John Riegert in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites Plea Agreement as per PLQ.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's motion to amend to Misd Level POT  Plea:  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  The Court:  Accepts resolution and imposes Court Costs only - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 23, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Johnson requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on December 16, 2014 at 09:20 am.
for Leave to File Additional Motions
Status conference on November 6, 2014 at 10:20 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 3:15 p.m. Defendant Logan John Riegert in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. Attorney Johnson will be representing the defendant and the co-defendant in this matter. The defendant waives any conflict with the dual representation. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits of the preliminary.  Motion by Atty Johnson to amend the bond to lift the no contact with the co-defendant. The court does amend the bond to remove the no contact conditions of bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance on October 8, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:09 p.m. Defendant Logan John Riegert in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting a high signature bond or low cash bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond. Court orders $3000 Sig Bond w/ conditions. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
